entry.title: MI07 Problema na atribuição de impostos (J1BTAX) em NF gerada por inventário
entry.content:
Olá, pessoal!
Estou com uma situação no SAP ECC relacionada à nota fiscal gerada automaticamente por inventário, onde apenas o primeiro item da nota tem a redução de base de ICMS corretamente atribuída. Os demais itens assumem grupos fiscais genéricos (10/99), ignorando o cadastro correto da J1BTAX.

Cenário:
A nota é gerada automaticamente após movimentação de inventário (ex: MB1A / 701).

A J1BTAX está corretamente configurada para todos os materiais.

A função J_1B_IM_TX_CALCULATE_TAX_NEW é chamada para o cálculo fiscal, e percebi que o problema acontece no PERFORM get_tax_parameters, onde para os itens a partir do segundo, o sistema já não localiza os grupos corretos.

A estrutura XKOMV[] já chega preenchida na função, mas aparentemente os KSCHL não refletem as condições como acontece na MIRO.

Testes já realizados:
Executei o mesmo cenário via MIRO: os impostos são aplicados corretamente a todos os itens.

Revisei a J_1BCONDMAPV, e os KSCHL estão mapeados corretamente.

Comparei a J1BTAX e o grupo de impostos por material — está tudo certo.

Debuguei a função e percebi que após o 1º item, a lógica de atribuição de grupo fiscal não consegue recuperar os dados da J1BTAX.

Na MIRO, o grupo fiscal é atribuído corretamente a todos os itens — no inventário, apenas ao primeiro.

Pergunta:
Existe alguma particularidade na chamada da função de cálculo de imposto quando a nota é gerada por movimento de mercadoria (inventário), que afete a leitura correta da J1BTAX ou do mapeamento fiscal?

Ou ainda:

Alguma recomendação de nota SAP, configuração complementar ou workaround para garantir que todos os itens da nota de inventário tenham os impostos atribuídos corretamente?

entry.title: Why does including hyperlinks change my paragraph's structure?
entry.content:
Hello @SAP, 

Just recently I noticed that my paragraph's structuring is changed drastically. This is happening retrospectively as all of my past blogs look affected. For example Preliminary What’s New Information for SAP S/4HANA... - SAP Community. 

I also tested this by creating a draft without any hyperlinks. The structure remains fine. As soon as I include the hyperlinks, the whole structure shifts around:

The text looks fine in the editing window. I double checked the HTML and there is no extra space included:

Is this a bug? Or am I doing something incorrect?

Thank you,

Diana

entry.title: SAP Ariba Sourcing
entry.content:
Dear all, My name is Emma Grant and I work for the United Nations, and we are using SAP Ariba Sourcing Classic.  I would like to enquire from other users whether you have started to use Guided Sourcing? if so what issues have you faced, and also whether you have been part of any forum where you have raised issues that you are dealing with and any resolutions that have been provided.  We have raised a list of things that are worse with guided and functionality that seems to have gone backwards. 

Any advise will be gratefully received and I look forward to hearing from you.

entry.title: Duplicate MATMAS IDoc Generation via POIM and BD10 – How to Prevent It?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently facing an issue while sending IDocs to an external system. The IDoc types involved are: MATMAS, LOIBOM, LOIWCS, LOIROU, and CLFMAS.

To trigger the IDocs, I’m using the transactions POIM and BD10:

  • When I run POIM, it always generates a MATMAS IDoc along with the others. As far as I can tell, this behavior cannot be suppressed.
  • Afterwards, I use BD10 to send a CLFMAS IDoc for classification data. However, BD10 also automatically generates and sends a MATMAS IDoc, even though it was already sent via POIM.

This results in the material master being sent twice with each export. Once via POIM and again via BD10.

My question: Is there a way to prevent BD10 from generating the MATMAS IDoc when it has already been sent via POIM?
Alternatively, is there another method to send CLFMAS without triggering another MATMAS?

Any insights or experiences would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: CDS migration to view entity in RAP OData V4 while preserving OData V2 and ABAP consumers A
entry.content: I have a released CDS consumption view built with define view that feeds SAC via OData V2 (@OData.publish: true) and is referenced in ABAP through the generated SQL view name. I need to migrate to RAP on OData V4 using CDS define view entity, keep semantics and DCL, preserve currency and unit annotations, and keep the old OData V2 contract alive for six months. What is a safe migration path to view entity that avoids breaking SAC and ABAP consumers, how do you handle the loss of @AbapCatalog.sqlViewName and existing dependencies, and what gotchas have you seen with associations, unions, nullability, analytical annotations, or client handling during this switch?

entry.title: JMS retry for Seconds Like 30 secs
entry.content:
Hi, 
    I configured the JMS and used a local integration for the retry mechanism as mentioned in the blogs. 
JMS configuration:
  No of Concurrenecy : 1
Retry intrerval: 1 min
exponential backoff : unchecked 

 Now what my use case like i want the retryu interval for every 30 secs how to achieve this.(as the JMS minimum time is in minutes )

Help me with this.


Thanks.

entry.title: SAP Customer Activity Repository
entry.content:

I’m currently exploring real-world SAP CAR (Customer Activity Repository) implementation success stories—particularly those that demonstrate measurable impact across retail.

If you or your organization have:

  • Achieved real-time inventory visibility.

  • Enhanced promotion effectiveness or customer insights.

  • Integrated SAP CAR with legacy or cloud systems.

  • Defined clear KPIs and tracked post-implementation ROI.

  I’d love to hear from you!

SAPCAR #SAPSuccessStory #RetailTech #DigitalTransformation #ERP #SupplyChain #SAPCommunity #EuropeBusiness

entry.title: Employee data review and farewell message task performed by HRADMIN in offboarding
entry.content:
Hi Everyone

I created a business rule where the Employee Data Review is performed by HRADMIN, and the Write Farewell Message in Offboarding task is also performed by HRADMIN.

Steps to configure:

  1. Create the Business Rule

  2. Under Onboarding General Settings, create a Responsible Group and assign all country-specific dynamic groups to it. Then, assign this responsible group to the Farewell Message task.

  3. Create country-specific dynamic groups and assign them to the responsible group you created

 

Regards,

Garima Saxena
